content: Ok, I do not want him committing files as he goes. As a matter of fact, I don't want him committing files or checking in at all. I want that to be clear. I will read his summary, pull his changes to GitHub, share with you, and we'll figure out what's next. All he needs to do is create the files and just document the final product as his last act before he returns. Can you modify it to capture the spirit of that? Like no checking in, just go and tell me about it when you're done. Also, he needs to review the full live-demonstration directory and build to that. There are additional physical specifications on my end he needs to take into consideration with these new capabilities. If we're going to make this sweet Claude, let's make this this sweet. What do you think? Do you want to revise your message or send the same. Fabulous outcomes either way.
